poem:
"Crossword Musings"

Once rigid grids of innocence,
Now cryptic glyphs of aptitude, dance.
29,254 lays in my grasp,
To surrender, or decipher, I am asked.
Through the labyrinth of ink, I stroll,
Each strike a defeated troll.
Oh, newspaper morning, casting riddles,
You cradle my day in cosmic twiddles.
